context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: double-check all transactions and receipts for the day to ensure there were no errors made in calculation or entering amounts in the register
check the security cameras to see if any unauthorized transactions took place
check the surveillance footage or talk to his coworkers to see if they noticed anything unusual during their shifts which could explain the missing money
check the bakery's security cameras or ask other employees if they saw anything unusual
check the receipts and sales records to ensure that all transactions have been accurately recorded
immediately report the issue to his superior or the owner of the bakery, explaining the situation and showing his good faith in wanting to resolve the issue correctly and honestly
contact his supervisor or the owner of the bakery to report the discrepancy and ask for assistance in resolving the issue
immediately report the discrepancy to his supervisor or the store owner
confirm the loss by recounting the cash in the register and cross-checking with the sales receipts of the day
check the receipts and transactions of the day to see if there were any errors or miscounted change

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.

generation: stay put and try to make their location visible from the air
stay put
start rationing their remaining food and water to ensure it lasts as long as possible
